definition: to set up a vendor's stall in the street
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
to set up a stall/to maintain a large staff and organization

sentences.english: They saidpeddling was the best job they could find.
sentences.chinese: 他们说摆摊是他们找到的最好的工作了。

sentences.english: Keep down seven on the roadside stalls set.
sentences.chinese: 压服七边在路边摆摊设局。

sentences.english: He has a pitch on the High Street where he sells souvenirs.
sentences.chinese: 他在大街上有个卖纪念品的摆摊处。

sentences.english: It is forbidden to set up a stall on campus without permission.
sentences.chinese: 未经同意，不得在校内摆摊设点。

sentences.english: I am at this spot every day.
sentences.chinese: 我天天都在这儿摆摊儿。

sentences.english: No entity or individual shall unlawfully put up stands or stalls within a zoo.
sentences.chinese: 任何单位和个人不得擅自在动物园内摆摊设点。

sentences.english: To make a living, Lu Bingdecides to set up a stall in the street .
sentences.chinese: 为了生活，鲁冰决定在街边摆摊挣钱。

sentences.english: The goldwater and qiu yun to livelihoods stalls selling the home of the fish.
sentences.chinese: 金水和秋娟为了生计摆摊卖起了家乡的鱼面。

sentences.english: ' Many of China's newly unemployed have begun selling goods on the street.
sentences.chinese: 很多最近失业的人员都开始在街道上摆摊卖货了。

sentences.english: His parents are fruit peddlers in a farm produce market.
sentences.chinese: 他父母在农贸市场摆摊儿卖水果。

definition: lit. to set up a stall on the ground/fig. to start up a new business
to set up a stall/to maintain a large staff and organization
to set up a vendor's stand
street stall with goods laid out on the ground
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
